subject: Politics
title: Flaws in Democracy
description: A quick, practical guide to Flaws in Democracy.

hook.text: Hitler was elected. So was Mussolini's coalition. Democracy can vote itself into destruction.

buildup.text: Democracies face real problems: voter ignorance, mob rule, short-term thinking, and manipulation.

discovery.text: Plato warned that democracy leads to demagogues who promise everything and deliver tyranny.

twist.text: Modern democracies add safeguards: courts, constitutions, and rights that majorities can't override.

climax.text: Still, democracies backslide. Hungary and Turkey show elected leaders can hollow out democracy.

punchline.text: Democracy can destroy itself. Only safeguards prevent it.

quiz.question: What did Plato warn about democracy?
options: It leads to demagogues who promise everything and deliver tyranny
It always produces the best leaders
